main_definition: The act of presenting or offering something formally, such as a proposal, application, request, or report.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To hand over or turn in (something) for consideration, acceptance, or action by an authority or organization
meanings_and_examples.example: I will submit my college application to the admissions office tomorrow.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To yield or give up oneself voluntarily and without resistance; surrender
meanings_and_examples.example: After a long negotiation, both parties agreed to submit themselves to arbitration.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To present a written or documented argument or proposal for approval or consideration
meanings_and_examples.example: She was submitting her research findings at the conference today.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To comply with authority or rules; follow orders or instructions
meanings_and_examples.example: The soldiers were instructed to submit themselves to a thorough search by their commanding officer.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To accept defeat gracefully and without protest
meanings_and_examples.example: In the end, they had to submit to the fact that they had lost the game.
